qas.question: Understanding who's work was the tradition meaning of Cubism formed on?
Who suggested that the artists other than Braque and Picasso's relgation to a distant role in Cubism was a mistake?
What other painters were not thought of as being as Cubist as Braque and Picasso?

answers.text: Jean Metzinger, Albert Gleizes, Robert Delaunay and Henri Le Fauconnier

qas.question: Understanding whose work was the tradition meaning of non-Cubism formed on?
Who suggested that the artists other than Braque and Picasso's relgation to a close role in Cubism was a mistake?

plausible_answers.text: Jean Metzinger, Albert Gleizes, Robert Delaunay and Henri Le Fauconnier

qas.question: What other painters were thought of as being as Cubist as Braque and Picasso?
Who said "o suggest that merely because these artists developed same as the traditional pattern"

context: The traditional interpretation of "Cubism", formulated post facto as a means of understanding the works of <a0_0><b3_0>Braque and Picasso<b3_0/><a0_0/>, has affected our appreciation of other twentieth-century artists. It is difficult to apply to painters such as <a2_0><b5_0>Jean Metzinger, Albert Gleizes, Robert Delaunay and Henri Le Fauconnier<b5_0/><a2_0/>, whose fundamental differences from traditional Cubism compelled Kahnweiler to question their right to be called Cubists at all. According to <a1_0><b4_0><b6_0>Daniel Robbins<b6_0/><b4_0/><a1_0/>, "To suggest that merely because these artists developed differently or varied from the traditional pattern they deserved to be relegated to a secondary or satellite role in Cubism is a profound mistake."
